bow: how do stay at home moms afford it working mom at the moment work at training facility amp make decent money my husband works at prison amp he also makes decent money but even with jobs we still struggle sometimes wondering how you stay at home moms afford to be stay at home moms what you sacrifice or how you budget to do so amp is it worth it moderate frugality and the fact that day care is expensive for the amount take home after paying for day care rather just spend the time with my baby and toddler until they are old enough for full days of school that is understandable do blame anyone for not wanting to pay for day care my mother actually watches my daughter for me now without charge but pregnant now amp know after have the baby will not want to go back to work it such hard decision to make because have always worked amp im afraid that we would not be able to afford it on just one income lot of moms know just do daycare for other parents good if you enjoy kids as working dad to stay at home mom it just comes down to economics she could certainly work but then we be paying for daycare for little ones she need to be making at least as much as am years into corporate office environment to break even unfortunately and due to recovery times that just too hard to find where we live mostly it comes down to finding an affordable place to live and hunkering down bit when it comes to large expenditures we often like to think that the kids would enjoy fancy trip to the snow even though we ca wait to see them play in it is it worth it is much harder question my wife is rockstar at the house and we have little ones both boys 25 yrs old and months old and it is tough they both love mom and want constant attention it can be exhausting frustrating and thankless but the kids adore mom nothing can get them to change tune or smile as much as when mom busts through the door after finally getting shower it also hard on marriage to be stay at home all day partner is shouldering the work of the children while the other shoulders the financial responsibility for the family it can be hard to remember that both are equally important and that both parties can use rest we live in the midwest where housing and costs are low we also have few rental properties that essentially replace what was making was in social work so my salary would have just covered day care love being sahm but also understand that we are very fortunate to be able to afford it also related meal planning and aldi shopping we love aldi mainly free activities cloth diapers and big garden haha think would love being stay at home mom feel like have missed out on so much with my daughter who is now love aldo amp already shop there ve thought about doing cloth diapers with the new baby once have it but have done much research on them just yet ve through about this but not exactly sure how feel about it you have good point also sure that it is hard being sahm just as it is being working mom yeah it not for everyone could do it think it important to maintain really strong communication between partners ca always claim to be the best at that but know it makes difference my wife put it in really simple way for me even if work is hard it change staying at home can sometimes feel like pretty long grind with very little daily reward beyond the love the children show if you re thinking of taking the sah leap just remember to talk about it with your partner do let it be one and done conversation keeping an open line as to what working for you and what is is fair and will ensure that there less feeling of regret frustration buyers remorse jealousy as time goes on teacher so if you think about it by the time we payed for daycare and took into account the amount our taxes would go up my income would push us into higher bracket really would make that much money it definitely hard lot of the time but we made budget and we try to stick to it need to make budget amp get rid of the bills that are to costly like our phone amp things like that we re in an area with really high housing costs it about 40 50 of our single income daycare costs for full time around here are also really high roughly 1000 mo when worked made about 2000 mo so half would have gone towards daycare and know would have hated it we re able to afford having me stay home by cutting out nearly all extras and asking for exactly what we need for our son for birthdays christmas from family we do lot of free cheap activities around town and ask for memberships to different places as gifts having me home also means less lunches out about 10 per day less dinners out 50+ each time and no more monthly transit pass 100+ mo also looked after another toddler twice week which brought in 450 month and we receive government child tax benefit that based off of income with those savings and small income we ve been able to get by for the past years was due yesterday so no longer watch the other 3yo but the government money will likely increase enough to cancel out that loss of income my husband will also have increases in his income over the years as he an apprentice in the trades ll look into returning to school when my youngest is about have bachelor but no real useful skills so that can start working when they re in school full time we re also looking to move out of the city soon where the cost of our condo will buy 3br house tldr you make it work spend less make do with less and ask for experience gifts rather than stuff that you do need yes understand my husband wants me to stay at home once we have another baby just because he wants me to get that experience amp not miss out on so much the way that did with our first child amp as child his mother stayed home with him amp that how he believes it should be we are just scared to take that leap wish could but would feel like never get time with just my own children you know how people are they will want you to watch them more amp more guessing that lot do have choice quit work to go back to school full time which has been damn nightmare let me tell you but pregnant with my second child now and the math just would have added up daycare for two kids in my area comes up to 1080 per month and my bring home pay while was working was something like 1200 that an awful lot of time somebody else has to raise my kids all for 120 you just have to do what you have to sometimes for some background was raised with working professionals parents dr and lawyer and had nannies for most of my childhood when got married was pretty sure wanted the same things for my kids but since having them would imagine doing it any other way am lucky that my mother watches my daughter for me daycare having nanny is expensive amp at least it is her grandma that spending time with her when not able to ❤️ yes understandable in your case it makes more sense for you to stay home with your baby bc you save money in my case my mother watches my daughter for free so would really save any money by being at home we set up our lives to live off one income ahead of time we bought smaller home used car that we paid off right away bought second hand furniture and electronics and slowly replaced them when we could afford it outright we gave up things for family time we live on budget but still have enough left to put into savings we have no payments other than our mortgage we have friends that live in the same area with both parents that have the same job as my husband and they are always broke but they also live beyond their means am sure they believe they could never live off one income as well but they wont ask themselves the difficult questions like do we need vehicles can we afford this camp trailer and quad and dirtbike can we afford this brand new furniture and tv we re making payments on its absolutely worth it we have plenty of quality family time my husband enjoys is job more because his home life is taken care of you can supplement your income by providing child care have done that off an on over the year have also gotten part time ob on occasion but more to get out of the house not because we needed the money thank you we have been thinking about moving my husband actually works an hour away so that lot of gas that he uses every day to get to work but if we moved we would save on gas money amp could stay at home amp we could only have one car instead of the we also plan to keep our life style affordable on one income even when return to work someday thats lot of disposable income if you keep it that way you could easily save money for big things and never be in debt again you could be mortgage free before you retire even we are renting right now while we work on our credit to start buying house but ca wait till can slowly bought them when was pregnant so it was big expense all at once it amounts to about extra loads of laundry week for us which is really nice diapers are expensive we definitely still use disposables here and there always when we travel but having to buy box every months is much more palatable that sounds awesome really going to consider it thank you ❤️ was part time teacher and live in the seattle area pretty much daycare costs more than make so being sahm was the obvious choice lot of my salary went to retirement but that mostly because we as couple really want to achieve early financial independence so we are fairly frugal to begin with it really helped that we already paid off student loans have no other debts beside mortgage and bought modest house few years ago before the market got too crazy but when interest rates were awesomely low that stabilized our monthly bills also my kiddo was the first grandchild for my parents so between the baby shower and my mom we got lot of baby stuff for free we are huge on spending to begin with we treat ourselves to occasional nice things that we feel matter we buy when we need but otherwise we do spend like spending time out of the house with my little man so we go to grocery stores often do always buy lot just like walking around and price comparing it allows me to buy things at more reasonable prices also if know something is wearing out and will need replacement start looking early so can buy the item when on sale find that we eat in more now which saves decent amount of money also have more time to research better deals when it comes to bigger projects for the house or try to do more diy rather than paying someone else to do the same job we also do have expensive hobbies we do have cable tv we rarely drink no smoking no coffee and we own modest cars we also live walking distance to library so we have access to free books movies music and playdates with the library when we bought our house we only considered one income mine which was considerably smaller think our mortgage payment was of our combined monthly income it still only 12 of my husband income think it so important to think what do we *actually* need instead of seeing the number loan officer will tell you that you can spend and spending it all same goes for cars and everything else guess do lot of crockpot cooking meal planning eating out is the one thing we majorly cut back on do watch the ads we get in the mail weekly for any really good grocery sales but do do any couponing get diapers wipes on amazon family which has saved bunch we already did have cable netflix is plenty also we dropped down tax bracket without my income and are eligible for some other deductions as result we are very fortunate just need to work on my credit some so that we can get mortgage happy what we have now it just enough but throwing money away on rent amp ive never used amazon family what is it we also do have cable because when we did we never watched it anyway so we have netflix as well amp usually it is just my daughter that watches that amazon family lets you set up subscriptions to all sorts of stuff you get 20 off diapers and if you have subscriptions each month you get 15 off the other items if you have less than it still off good luck with the eventual home buying it exciting to get out of renting that awesome thanks so much ❤️ that awesome thanks so much ❤️ do think of rent as throwing your money away renting is much more predictable expense when working with tight budget and the peace of mind that you just need to make phone call when the air conditioner goes out instead of opening up your wallet is fantastic benefit we chose cheaper housing have no plans of upgrading our cars eat out very infrequently buy clothes at the thrift store and take advantage of free entertainment it sounds like you have enough things going for you that you can make it happen good luck yes that is something that do love about renting is having someone else fix everything that wrong 1080 for two kids where it 1600 for one kid here yes this hate the argument that renting is throwing away money does renting not get you roof maintenance and free repairs not having to pay taxes not having to replace roof or hvac system if it breaks not having to worry about annual tax assessments that will increase your tax bill it so silly save us money wherever can we eat frugally can freeze or dehydrate everything that comes out of our garden buy seconds from our farmers market cut out unnecessary expenses no cable television we have netflix and hulu instead of buying books dvds and video games we use the public library last week part on the kitchen sink needed replaced did call plumber watched some youtube videos and fixed it myself sometimes pick up little extra income by house sitting we live very frugally have no car payments paid off all of our student loans and we still ca afford for me to stay at home rent+utilities equals about 30 of our combined income and we moved further to less desirable neighborhood to cut that back we make about 6k per month and rent alone is 1500 we also want to be able to retire so we max our 401ks college is important so we want to be able to open 529 for our son groceries are exorbitant here and we eat healthily so there that too daycare is minimum of 1600 per month but it not just the money leaving the workforce would also mean not getting those years of experience not getting 401k match not networking with other professionals in my field so going back to work part time but the opportunity loss is just as limiting as the loss in pay thanks so much ❤️ by being little frugal and limiting expenses we do pay for cable we have no pets we do smoke or drink and one of our vehicles is completely paid off common sense use of utilities feel helps more than people realize do leave lights on the house remains the same temperature year round only one tv in the house and it turned off when not in use the most extravagant thing we pay for is good internet because it our main source of entertainment our main weakness is going out to eat but even then it to places like chick fil or steak and shake thrift stores for children clothes and toys and discount grocery stores for food generic everything also sell lot of what my son grows out of setting budget my husband is very fiscally minded and sets budget for each month factoring for slightly less than he makes which leaves room to add money to savings we ve had few emergencies that we were able to cover thanks to what was in savings the budget also affords me some personal spending money so that nice and unfortunately opting out of health insurance for everyone but me since currently expecting once the baby is born we hope to get both kids on something gt we set up our lives to live off one income ahead of time we bought smaller home used car that we paid off right away bought second hand furniture and electronics and slowly replaced them when we could afford it outright we gave up things for family time we live on budget but still have enough left to put into savings we have no payments other than our mortgage this from almost our first date my husband and built our life together with the understanding that was going to be sahm until she starts full day school we paid off everything besides our mortgage and we bought smaller cheaper than our budget allowed before she was born and while was still working in the end though we really lucked out with him getting new job when she was month old with pay raise that essentially replaced my income second hand cloth are much cheaper and are fine we do cloth at home and eco friendly when out we already buy most clothes 2nd hand no problem it rural kentucky child care is cheap but so is my labor apparently honestly ca afford to work have special needs preschooler and daycare for him plus my one year old would run over 2200 month facilities that have teachers trained to work with special needs kids are rare and expensive great will save you packet also check out cloth wipes know another person already explained amazon family but like to add couple things you need to be an amazon prime member to sign up for amazon family think prime is 99 year now if you ever order something with prime with guaranteed delivery date and it late you can hop on chat with them to complain and they will extend your membership by month also diaper prices can change quite often on amazon camelcamelcamel com tracks amazon prices and will let you set up email alters to notify you when something drops below price you want it will also show the lowest and highest prices it has seen for any item and give you graph of price changes over the last few months or years only the first order of your amazon subscription has the price locked in all the following orders will ship at whatever price it happens to be that week so always cancel the subscription after the first shipment and wait until see price like to re subscribe it sounds like kind of hassle but find it much easier than waiting for sales and clipping coupons to buy at the local store and ve gotten diapers for half the usual price by using amazon example think paid 13 for the last box of 124 size pampers swaddlers bought my husband has fairly high paying job and had fairly low paying job we do have family in the area so paying for daycare would have cost us more than my paycheck glad stay at home mom but it would have really been good option if had wanted to keep working that crazy amp very expensive at least you get to spend more time with those babies ❤️ you re right at least you enjoy staying home love crock pot meals dang that good deal on diapers we had to ease into it it scary at first but for us we are able to do it by honestly owning duplex we live on one side and rent the other side out we only pay about 300 month on our mortgage we also do have cable one car is paid off and the other is only 100 month also when it comes to groceries shop at place called winco and all my food is their generic brand so not whole lot of organics for us is it worth it oh my gosh yes ll have the rest of my life to work plan on heading back when the kids are all in school these years are priceless to me sure things are tight and cramped in this house but my kids do know any different and couldnt care less if they are knock off wheat thins thank god all the for this opportunity derp totally forgot about the prime aspect thanks my last boxes of size 148 count swaddlers were 14 71 it so worth it to price stalk dang 300 is really good deal we pay 500 which is to bad amp always buy off brand groceries for the most part glad you are enjoying time with your kiddos ❤️ we intentionally worked to develop marketable skills that would get us better paying jobs we did the math and did make enough money to cover the cost of childcare my entire paycheck would have been for daycare so it made more sense that stay home and raise my own child rather than keeping my shitty job so he could be somewhere else all day that good when we do the math am better off keeping my job just because my mother watches my daughter for free but so badly want to stay home that nice though that you have your mom all of our family lives out of state so anytime we need to do anything without kids we have to pay babysitter so it adds up quickly removed in addition to all the other awesome advice here already about meal planning and budgeting definitely second aldi shopping it saves ton in grocery bills but also my husband and pick up little odd jobs around town every now and then and that really helps out surprisingly mostly computer repair stuff for older people running businesses we were in assistance for awhile until my husband got regular adult paying job not the bs he found in the past no cable no fast food one car staying home no vacation or trips basically making it work because we had to then he got 17 an hour and we lost food stamps so we bought less food and still came out about the same insurance still through medicaid my daughter 2nd kid was born with disabilities so we get ssi and she goes to medical daycare during the day that paid by insurance without ssi we would barely make rent husband quit and job found part time jobs and is juggling schedules just waiting on my son to turn in january so he can go to free vpk and can go back to work otherwise ll be going to work and bring home 50 week before taxes after daycare if had typical kids there no way we afford to live the way we are now managed to get my credit into fair range and got my own car this year just because all the dr visits and drop off and pick up were doing was too much for one car wic helps ton too since my daughter needs formula now and what they do cover my medical supply company will provide through insurance we get lots of milk veggies and fruits and bread through wic so that helps bunch too anything else goes on credit cards as an emergency and gets paid off slowly when we can pay on it other than the min payment it tough and so ready to have my son in daycare we make too much still for free daycare but not enough to justify full price daycare that why the wait till it not income based at when my son was born to about loved being stay at home but after that he really was showing signs of needing socialization with peers and such got zoo membership so we can go blow of steam and they have huge play place where he can interact with other kids otherwise be at home pulling my hair out while he tantrums and cries that how we manage for now we already shop aldo amp we love it yes it does my mom usually only watches my daughter while work so if need to do anything else have to find babysitter which is understandable bc my mother does watch her everyday for us we own smaller home our cars are paid off and 13 14 years old we try to make fiscally responsible decisions and though we struggle sometimes we are able to save little bit what was making would have just gone to daycare did have career when we had our first my husband did all our parents work did have the options our parents did because of that my kids are in school now but there are bus services and would still have to be there for them after school and during the summer as they are quite old enough to walk home alone or be home alone for few hours want to find something part time but summer is still something to consider until they are little older being sahm has been hard and we are as well off as we potentially could have been put my life on hold and know the biggest sacrifice will be any career may have had that something ve just accepted at this point on the other hand can help them with homework know what going on at school involved and grateful for that luxury volunteer at the school get to know the principal and teachers can take the kids to the doctor when they are sick and easily care for them do have the stress so many moms do over childcare and school schedules this may not work for some moms but it works for us for me could make enough to cover day care for three kids this year ll have two kids in school though and idk how we re going to afford that expense there are two options and one of which is 1800 month for two kids that what would really love even though my daughter is in school yet id love to be able to be more involved amp my job that will be hard to do omgsh that is crazy everything is so expensive now days us too was making around 1700 mo and where live that the price of daycare if only we had family around ca afford date nights either know it possible but it hard my mom did it she was single mom though my dad lived nearby my grandma watched me when was little her career suffered though if honest she was able to catch back up to my dad even now she makes of what he does and they are in similar fields when we were sick she took time off she went to parent teacher conferences she was as involved as she could be had to switch my mindset to this now nervous to own so many things can go wrong at the drop of hat and you have to take care of it yourself know but me being pregnant my 2nd child want to be able to stay at home it feel as if have missed half of my daughters life because have been working so much amp missed lot of her milestones when she was younger winco is *amazing* we re actually going shopping there tonight my mom said the same thing when she was pregnant with my little brother and she did take some time off work for couple years completely understand that is one more thing incredibly grateful for have had to miss their milestones whatever you decide you just have to do what best for your family thank you so much ❤️ my day care is 1400 for one not fancy either just live in an expensive area my best friend and her husband do make ton of money everything they do is pretty tightly controlled so she can stay at home frankly if she had reliable childcare near their home they live bit rurally bet she would be back to work they do not travel besides yearly trip back to her husband home state to see family they go out to eat once month at cheapy rice bento place with their kids they shop at the cheapest stores they eat lot of rice beans and cheap cuts of meat but they have sweet kids and they re happy am sahm and my husband makes lot of money so it is easy for me to stay at home but am grateful had the ability to choose think the reasons are all over the board but you are doing great job whether you work or stay at home awh thank you so much ❤️ see think that is where am stuck right now we struggle sometimes but not often we still have money to buy nice things if we want them we have extra money to go do things if we want etc worried that just one income we have to do without more than what we would like but think be willing to sacrifice those things to stay at home my babies got surprised with twins and had to unexpectedly quit working because paying for daycare for infants and one school aged kid was more than made not to mention all the troubles that come along with daycare and calling in sick to work finally learned how to cook cooking from scratch more and really learning how to use and vary staples like beans rice chicken and vegetables plus not eating out or ordering much has enabled me to keep the grocery bill low do eat out or order lunch like did when was working it tight but it only few years until they re in school and can work again my husband works in the military and they have dependent pay that helps small monthly stipend for each dependent wife child it nice that they take into account that some spouse jobs do travel well picking up every years will crush certain career paths and seriously limit your earning potential otherwise we found great rental well beneath market have list of things really want but just say no to myself it does matter how many ways can justify it needed to change the definition of need talking about montessori kindergarten for my older two unfortunately we do meet the income requirements for free preschool and my 4yo is too old for the preschool program at the montessori and all the other schools are religious which we do want for sure so our only option is public for my oldest and nothing for my middle or the over priced montessori new place is opening soon but it saying it private school so it may be just as expensive twins that sounds awesome but know that your hands are full could imagine how expensive babies would be need to work on my cooking skills can cook just not everything is from scratch sure it is lot more affordable picking up having to move every years would be hard thing to do but sure you handle it well much better that probably could ❤️ removed know you do want religious but some preschools at churchs are not overly religious just thought despite multiple degrees and pretty positive work record have been able to find work that pays more than hr in years ca afford daycare on that so home we work really hard at frugality and at living within or below our means this has meant sacrificing lot living in an apartment rather than house no vacations minimizing luxuries but it the initial experience of change that is the hardest part not actual cuts when actually first really dug into our budget actually broke down previous months bank statements to make them fully representative was little shocked by what we were spending where thought had good working knowledge of our finances but had several blindspots that is good idea to see where everything goes small things add up fast their websites mention teaching prayers and songs and such which not fan of do mind religion but also do want to teach it to my kids do feel like they re old enough to understand or make their own decisions on faith yet we re atheist and do want to influence our kids one way or the other same experience worked for short time jus to get out of the house but bringing home 10 20 or so after an hour shift is demoralizing plus you re still taxed for most of the earned income if remember correctly could only write off about 20 of my childcare expenses after taxes and daycare was working for hr there an app that does it for you mint but it only kind of accurate and it one more place where your financial info could be exposed if there security breach in some states you ca even babysit if you make at least 500 yr without an extensive state inspection and licensing fees for cloth diapering check out the facebook group fluff love and cloth diaper science they have information on charity that helps people who do have the funds start cloth diapering think it called the rebecca foundation get what you are saying but if it only for preschool they will forget if not reinforced if it huge saving in money for you it might be worth it my daughter when to catholic one for years part time then public school it was few religious songs and church times total she barely remembers that stuff but again it totally your choice stay at home mom and it really depends on your income and your bills we knew that would stay home when we did have kids so we bought home for way less of what we could afford 160k and were approved for 400k so we could afford it on just his income it was sacrifice to not buy our dream home but we still live in very nice suburban area with great schools and our home is big enough for us just older and not super updated working on that currently but it works we also dumped cable and switched to just netflix and amazon since we do really watch much tv anymore which saved us 70 month and since stay home can cook all our meals and make sure it affordable since have the time which cut about 200 month also have older car since do drive as much so do need something fancy he has newer car but it almost paid off other then that we have sacrificed much though when was months pregnant my husband got new job and went from making 80k year to 130k year and only made 40k year when worked so we only made 120k combined when got pregnant before his new job so me quitting did hurt us at all and he actually makes more then we used to combined am going back to work though in few months since my daughter will be doing full time preschool anyways so might as well we are considering maybe upgrading our home then but we will see no plans for anymore kids any time soon oh ok down vote me because we make good financial decisions patterns all kinda boyish but not exclusively have pockets some flips some grovia almost all of them are adjustable size pme if you are interested would love to get rid of them and help someone get going on the cloth train we payed someone under the table to take the big kid to school pick her up and watch the baby from 30 2:30 five days week after paying that which was hundreds of dollars less than if we payed for qualified nanny took home 100 week which is not worth it but on top of that was getting up at 5am waking up multiple times night working like dog from 30 then coming home and doing all childcare until my husband came home juuuuust in time for the night routine except for the nights week that he works 13 hours and is home until after everyone in bed and doing the majority of the housework because my husband is was home when most of it needed to be done so the 100 week was worth all that extra work stress and unhappiness taxes do work that way say you make 50k now and pay 20 in taxes if you were to earn 75k instead your first 50k would still be taxed at 20 and only the additional 25k would be taxed higher let say at 25 made up numbers for this purpose it not possible for you to make less money by going up into higher tax bracket the higher rates only apply to the amount above the lower bracket income in the us it common misunderstanding about how tax brackets work think ve tried using that app before amp did really care for it okay ll check it out thanks so much really is cloth diapers all different sizes amp how much would you sell them for that how feel now wake up at am amp get off at and come home to ton of house work but making more than 100 week and we do have to pay for child care just wan na be home my babies if we had had to pay for childcare or could have had them both in care for reasonable amount would have kept working it worth it for the getting out of the house aspect after six years of not but it was almost that amount for daycare and before school care and the rebate here at the time only covered around nine months of the year so for the last three months of the financial year would have been paying 800ish week and that was actually more than earned if went to work we would have to pay for daycare and the increased income would make any difference so decided staying home was the better option than me having work escape lot of people are saying that they re better off staying home but in my case have free child care so id be better off working unfortunately wow here you can but there are some pretty strict rules for unlicensed homes being licensed is nightmare but you can make very good money yes they comes in different size and form have mo old and we have been cloth diapering since she was newborn totally worth it check out green mountain diapers thats where bought all of my stash am new to reddit so dont know if there is cloth diapering subreddit wo lie it hard made more money than my husband but always knew wanted my kids to grow up with me as their primary caretaker before quit we built up our savings really wish we had just lived on my husband paycheck and saved mine to prepare but we were that disciplined now we try to follow dave ramsey principles and try to be frugal not big into clothes shopping so that helps the area where tend to overspend is food love grocery shopping use an app that allows me to divide my money into electronic envelopes and love it it motivates me to save even if it just little here and there so that can get some of the extras that miss from when worked outside the home do make extra money on the side with some of my personal hobbies and skills it not much but gives me some extra money to spend or save when was working full time we ate out ton so now we save with me being able to cook most of the time would also spend money on coffees cupcakes treats to bring to work and all kinds of things that can just make myself at home for much cheaper we save on gas because my job was 30 minutes from home find save more on my purchases because have more time to shop around and check out prices at different stores whereas when was working if we wanted something we wanted it now and did not have time to go to multiple stores plan to start gardening as well to save on produce all of these are little things but they do add up the most burdensome part about being frugal to me is feeling restricted socially want to still maintain relationships with friends and most of the time that involves going out for food or drinks still try to make it out of the house regularly for my sanity but now look for more free things to do there are plenty of free activities in the city ve been able to do with friends instead of spending ton on drinks or dinner or invite people for home cooked meal or movie night in general have tried to change my mindset to be more of producer and less of consumer however can now contribute to our household by finding ways to
